British Residency and Consulate-General, Bushire, 8th June 1927, From To Captain C.G.Prior, I.A., Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. The Political Agent, Bahrain. Sir, With reference to your letter No. 120-C., dated the 10th Kay 1927, I am directed to state that the Hon♦hie the Political Resident has seen Shaikh Ali Ihn Shaikh Mahomed and informed him that as he had done good work for Major Daly he did not want to disgrace him 'by dismissal and that it would be better if he resigned the Service. Shaikh Ali has resigned with effect from 1st June 1927. The papers of the enquiry received with your letter are returned. I have the honour to be, Sir, Your most obedient servant. Capt., Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. Copy to Major C.0.J.Barrett, C.S.I., C.I.E., Political Agent, Kuwait, for information. ^ ^C -e. C^c « /iUs

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.
Foliation: Circled in pencil, in the top right corner of each folio. It begins on the front cover, on number 1, and runs through to 17, ending on the inside of the back cover.

mods.abstract: This file contains a letter between Cyril Charles Barrett, British Political Agent at Bahrain, and Charles Geoffrey Prior, Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire, as well as a 14-page confidential report.These papers concern the personality of Shaikh ‘Alī bin Shaikh Muḥammad, the Agency interpreter, and a series of charges against him for accepting sums of money from Bahraini peasants so as to facilitate their acquisition of farm land and property sequestered by the State from the Āl Dawāsir tribe and from Shaikh Khālid in the early 1920s.
